name: Apex
blurb: Charismatic, dangerous, loyal. Eats like a king, fights like a storm, laughs like it won’t last.

tiers.title: Road Banter
tiers.notes: Food, jokes, minor rivalry that keeps the nerves from showing.

tiers.title: Old Scars
tiers.notes: Why he joined the league; fear of being replaced by the next legend.

tiers.title: The Unspoken Contract
tiers.notes: Hints at giantkin politics and the string-pullers who set the fights.

nodes.text: Apex flips a coin across his knuckles and asks how you keep your hands steady before a fight.

text_variants.smith: Apex flips a coin across his knuckles and asks how you keep your hands steady before a fight. He notices your calluses like a badge.
text_variants.bard: Apex flips a coin across his knuckles and asks how you keep your hands steady before a fight. He wants a line worth repeating.
text_variants.quartermaster: Apex flips a coin across his knuckles and asks how you keep your hands steady before a fight. He pretends it’s banter, but he’s taking your measure.

nodes.text: He rolls back a sleeve, showing old league scars, and asks what you would trade for victory.

text_variants.leatherworker: He rolls back a sleeve, showing old league scars, and asks what you would trade for victory. He tests if you know the price of skin.
text_variants.historian: He rolls back a sleeve, showing old league scars, and asks what you would trade for victory. He wants to know how you record the cost.
text_variants.bard: He rolls back a sleeve, showing old league scars, and asks what you would trade for victory. He wants the answer he can live with.

nodes.text: He admits the league made him sign an oath he regrets — and hints at who holds the pen.

text_variants.infobroker: He admits the league made him sign an oath he regrets — and hints at who holds the pen. He wants to know if you recognize the signature.
text_variants.quartermaster: He admits the league made him sign an oath he regrets — and hints at who holds the pen. He watches how you count the debt.
text_variants.historian: He admits the league made him sign an oath he regrets — and hints at who holds the pen. He asks if you would write that name down.

nodes.text: He repeats the shaman’s blessing with surprising care.

text_variants.bard: He repeats the shaman’s blessing with surprising care, as if guarding the rhythm.
text_variants.smith: He repeats the shaman’s blessing with surprising care, the way you repeat a dangerous process.
text_variants.relicator: He repeats the shaman’s blessing with surprising care, and you hear a hidden cadence.

name: Dedor
blurb: Measured voice, sharp eyes. Notices what everyone else avoids and refuses to let it slide.

tiers.title: Campfire Ethics
tiers.notes: He asks what you believe in, and how far it stretches.

tiers.title: The Map of Consequence
tiers.notes: Reframes choices as debts, not wins.

tiers.title: A Secret He Won’t Write Down
tiers.notes: Knows something about the chest, and about who sent it.

nodes.text: Dedor asks what you would burn to keep the pilgrims safe.

text_variants.architect: Dedor asks what you would burn to keep the pilgrims safe. He waits to see if you can name a structure.
text_variants.historian: Dedor asks what you would burn to keep the pilgrims safe. He waits to see if you can name a story.
text_variants.quartermaster: Dedor asks what you would burn to keep the pilgrims safe. He expects you to say supplies.

nodes.text: He sketches a map of debts in the dust, naming the league as the biggest creditor.

text_variants.historian: He sketches a map of debts in the dust, naming the league as the biggest creditor. He asks who keeps the ledger.
text_variants.infobroker: He sketches a map of debts in the dust, naming the league as the biggest creditor. He wants to know which link you would cut.
text_variants.cartographer: He sketches a map of debts in the dust, naming the league as the biggest creditor. It looks uncomfortably like your routes.

nodes.text: He confesses he once worked for the league — just long enough to learn their blind spot.

text_variants.infobroker: He confesses he once worked for the league — just long enough to learn their blind spot. He asks if you know yours.
text_variants.historian: He confesses he once worked for the league — just long enough to learn their blind spot. He asks if you will write it down.
text_variants.architect: He confesses he once worked for the league — just long enough to learn their blind spot. He tells you where the wall is weak.

nodes.text: He quietly recites the blessing like a vow.

text_variants.historian: He quietly recites the blessing like a vow, the way treaties are sealed.
text_variants.relicator: He quietly recites the blessing like a vow, and you feel the ritual tighten.
text_variants.quartermaster: He quietly recites the blessing like a vow, and you feel the weight of the promise.

name: Theramous
blurb: A calm presence with a habit of being right at the worst possible time.

tiers.title: Tradecraft Talk
tiers.notes: He asks about your craft and listens like it matters.

tiers.title: The League’s Math
tiers.notes: Explains why the league always seems to be ahead of the rumor mill.

tiers.title: A Promise in Ink
tiers.notes: You learn what he is trying to protect by staying in the party.

nodes.text: Theramous asks about your craft and promises to keep the ledgers straight.

text_variants.quartermaster: Theramous asks about your craft and promises to keep the ledgers straight. He means it.
text_variants.alchemist: Theramous asks about your craft and promises to keep the ledgers straight. He wants to know which mixtures you won’t name.
text_variants.architect: Theramous asks about your craft and promises to keep the ledgers straight. He listens for how you measure risk.

nodes.text: He breaks down the league’s logistics and how to slip between them.

text_variants.cartographer: He breaks down the league’s logistics and how to slip between them. He asks you to redraw your map.
text_variants.infobroker: He breaks down the league’s logistics and how to slip between them. He wants to know which contact you would burn.
text_variants.quartermaster: He breaks down the league’s logistics and how to slip between them. He looks at you like you already knew.

nodes.text: He shows you a promise written in invisible ink — and trusts you with it.

text_variants.relicator: He shows you a promise written in invisible ink — and trusts you with it. You feel the magic where it shouldn’t be.
text_variants.historian: He shows you a promise written in invisible ink — and trusts you with it. He asks if you will keep it unrecorded.
text_variants.quartermaster: He shows you a promise written in invisible ink — and trusts you with it. You hear a debt that can’t be repaid.

name: Widjet
blurb: A pocketful of springs and wisdom disguised as nonsense.

tiers.title: Gadget Nights
tiers.notes: Shows you a strange hinge-mechanism.

tiers.title: Laughing at Giants
tiers.notes: Explains giant sports rituals with unsettling accuracy.

tiers.title: Hidden Compartment
tiers.notes: He saw something inside the chest when no one was watching.

nodes.text: Widjet produces a hinge made of three metals and asks which one you would keep.

text_variants.smith: Widjet produces a hinge made of three metals and asks which one you would keep. He expects you to name the flaw.
text_variants.relicator: Widjet produces a hinge made of three metals and asks which one you would keep. You hear a trick in the metal.
text_variants.bard: Widjet produces a hinge made of three metals and asks which one you would keep. He wants the answer that makes him laugh.

nodes.text: He explains a giant sports ritual with unsettling accuracy.

text_variants.historian: He explains a giant sports ritual with unsettling accuracy. He’s unusually careful with the names.
text_variants.cartographer: He explains a giant sports ritual with unsettling accuracy. He draws the field like a map.
text_variants.bard: He explains a giant sports ritual with unsettling accuracy. He mimics the chants under his breath.

nodes.text: He admits he saw something inside the chest when no one was watching.

text_variants.relicator: He admits he saw something inside the chest when no one was watching. He asks if you believe him.
text_variants.infobroker: He admits he saw something inside the chest when no one was watching. He waits to see if you buy the story.
text_variants.smith: He admits he saw something inside the chest when no one was watching. He swears it wasn’t a hinge.

name: Jeffery
role: Pilgrim — the only one who can open the chest
blurb: No league ties. Quiet, competent. The key is not metal.

tiers.title: Hands of Ceremony
tiers.notes: Hints at opening as a rite, not a trick.

tiers.title: The Chest’s True Lock
tiers.notes: A vow. A name. A sacrifice? (kept non-graphic).

tiers.title: Who Sent You?
tiers.notes: He tests whether you’re league-clean or league-tainted.

nodes.text: Jeffery says the chest doesn’t open with force; it opens with permission.

text_variants.relicator: Jeffery says the chest doesn’t open with force; it opens with permission. You feel the ritual in the word.
text_variants.smith: Jeffery says the chest doesn’t open with force; it opens with permission. You set your tools down anyway.
text_variants.historian: Jeffery says the chest doesn’t open with force; it opens with permission. You wonder who grants it.

nodes.text: He hints the true lock is a vow, not a key.

text_variants.bard: He hints the true lock is a vow, not a key. He asks what you would sing to seal it.
text_variants.infobroker: He hints the true lock is a vow, not a key. He asks who you would bind.
text_variants.alchemist: He hints the true lock is a vow, not a key. You wonder what it reacts to.

nodes.text: He asks who you’d let touch the chest if you never returned.

text_variants.quartermaster: He asks who you’d let touch the chest if you never returned. You think about who can keep a secret.
text_variants.historian: He asks who you’d let touch the chest if you never returned. You think about who would tell the truth.
text_variants.relicator: He asks who you’d let touch the chest if you never returned. You think about who can bear the magic.

name: Iria
blurb: Hums when nervous. Knows the old giant words and when not to use them.

tiers.title: Old Hymns
tiers.notes: She teaches you a phrase that means safe passage.

nodes.text: Iria teaches a quiet phrase meaning safe passage, then asks you not to waste it.

text_variants.historian: Iria teaches a quiet phrase meaning safe passage, then asks you not to waste it. She wants it remembered the right way.
text_variants.bard: Iria teaches a quiet phrase meaning safe passage, then asks you not to waste it. She refuses to sing it.

name: Rook
blurb: Can calm beasts with a look. Keeps the offering secure and resents sloppy knots.

tiers.title: Load & Balance
tiers.notes: He shows you how to shift weight so the cart doesn’t betray you.

nodes.text: Rook shows how to shift weight so the cart never squeals, then asks if you trust him with the chest.

text_variants.quartermaster: Rook shows how to shift weight so the cart never squeals, then asks if you trust him with the chest. You hear the question behind the question.
text_variants.leatherworker: Rook shows how to shift weight so the cart never squeals, then asks if you trust him with the chest. He checks your straps without asking.

name: Sable
blurb: Speaks rarely; notices everything, refuses to say how.

tiers.title: Eyes on the League
tiers.notes: She points out the signs of being followed.

nodes.text: Sable points out the signs of being followed, then goes quiet again as if she said too much.

text_variants.infobroker: Sable points out the signs of being followed, then goes quiet again as if she said too much. You trade a glance of mutual caution.
text_variants.cartographer: Sable points out the signs of being followed, then goes quiet again as if she said too much. You note the marks on your map.

name: Brann
blurb: Professional. Not cheap. Not sentimental, which is its own kind of honesty.

tiers.title: Hard Terms
tiers.notes: He explains what your coin actually buys.

nodes.text: Brann explains what your coin buys — and what it doesn’t. He wants it said out loud.

text_variants.quartermaster: Brann explains what your coin buys — and what it doesn’t. He approves of the clarity, not the price.
text_variants.bard: Brann explains what your coin buys — and what it doesn’t. He refuses to sugarcoat it.

name: Mira
blurb: Smiles while counting exits. Knows the wind by its habits.

tiers.title: Tracks in Snow
tiers.notes: She teaches you to read wind like handwriting.

nodes.text: Mira teaches you to read wind like handwriting, and admits the league writes in a heavy hand.

text_variants.cartographer: Mira teaches you to read wind like handwriting, and admits the league writes in a heavy hand. You adjust your lines.
text_variants.infobroker: Mira teaches you to read wind like handwriting, and admits the league writes in a heavy hand. You wonder who taught her.

name: Kest
blurb: Speaks in short sentences; hits in longer distances.

tiers.title: No Heroics
tiers.notes: He warns you about league hunters.

nodes.text: Kest warns you the league’s arrows don’t miss twice. He means the first shot is the warning.

text_variants.smith: Kest warns you the league’s arrows don’t miss twice. He taps the fletching like a craftsman.
text_variants.leatherworker: Kest warns you the league’s arrows don’t miss twice. He eyes your armor and says nothing.

name: Master Orlan
blurb: A veteran craftsperson who treats wounds like flawed steel, and people like steel with flaws.

tiers.title: Lessons Paid in Sweat
tiers.notes: He offers to teach… if you earn it.

nodes.text: Master Orlan critiques your hammer stance and offers a correction without softening the truth.

text_variants.smith: Master Orlan critiques your hammer stance and offers a correction without softening the truth. He expects you to take it.
text_variants.architect: Master Orlan critiques your hammer stance and offers a correction without softening the truth. He watches how you adapt.

nodes.text: He teaches a repair trick that saves supplies in a pinch, then asks what you would give up to keep the caravan whole.

text_variants.smith: He nods at your build, then shares a forge trick only smiths should know. He asks what you’d sacrifice to keep the steel true.
text_variants.quartermaster: He teaches a repair trick that saves supplies in a pinch, then asks what you would give up to keep the caravan whole. He wants an honest answer.

name: Pip
blurb: Wants to see giantland someday. Talks too fast and listens too hard.

tiers.title: Pocket Questions
tiers.notes: Asks you what giants are really like.

nodes.text: Pip peppers you with questions about giantland and the chest, then blurts that they want to make something that lasts.

text_variants.smith: Pip peppers you with questions about giantland and the chest, then blurts that they want to make something that lasts. They watch your hands.
text_variants.historian: Pip peppers you with questions about giantland and the chest, then blurts that they want to make something that lasts. They ask how you remember things.

name: Lysa
blurb: Practical kindness. Protects her children with her spine and her silence.

tiers.title: Shared Fire
tiers.notes: A small act of care changes the whole mood of camp.

nodes.text: Lysa thanks you for taking her children in and offers to share rations she can’t really spare.

text_variants.quartermaster: Lysa thanks you for taking her children in and offers to share rations she can’t really spare. You notice how little she kept.
text_variants.bard: Lysa thanks you for taking her children in and offers to share rations she can’t really spare. Her gratitude sounds like relief and fear together.

name: Nell
blurb: Curious, brave, and not impressed by adults.

tiers.title: Stories for Coins
tiers.notes: She trades local gossip for a bedtime tale.

nodes.text: Nell trades gossip for a bedtime story, then corrects your ending.

text_variants.bard: Nell trades gossip for a bedtime story, then corrects your ending. She wants the part where someone listens.
text_variants.historian: Nell trades gossip for a bedtime story, then corrects your ending. She remembers the details adults miss.

name: Hob
blurb: Quiet until he laughs. Then you remember why you keep walking.

tiers.title: Lucky Charm
tiers.notes: He gives you a trinket for the bad nights.

nodes.text: Hob gives you a lucky trinket for the rough nights and asks if you’re scared, too.

text_variants.leatherworker: Hob gives you a lucky trinket for the rough nights and asks if you’re scared, too. You tie it to your gear.
text_variants.relicator: Hob gives you a lucky trinket for the rough nights and asks if you’re scared, too. You feel a faint hum.
